revision.comment: Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/2A02:C7F:526B:7C00:3034:3DEF:461D:9722|2A02:C7F:526B:7C00:3034:3DEF:461D:9722]] ([[User talk:2A02:C7F:526B:7C00:3034:3DEF:461D:9722|talk]]): Villa loan deal is over ([[WP:TW|TW]])
revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=June 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2013}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Yannick Bolasie | image = Yannick Bolasie2.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Bolasie playing for [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] in 2015 | fullname = Yannick Bolasie{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=11 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1989|5|24|df=y}}{{Cite book | editor-first = Barry J. | editor-last = Hugman | title = The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2009–10 | year = 2009 | publisher = Mainstream Publishing | isbn = 978-1-84596-474-0}} | birth_place = [[Lyon]], France | height = 1.85 m{{cite web |title=Player Profile: Yannick Bolasie |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/players/y/yb/yannick-bolasie |publisher=Everton F.C. |accessdate=19 August 2017}} | position = [[Midfielder#Winger|Winger]] | currentclub = [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]]
(on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]) | clubnumber = 7 | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[Rushden & Diamonds F.C.|Rushden & Diamonds]] | years1 = 2006–2007 | clubs1 = [[Hillingdon Borough F.C.|Hillingdon Borough]] | caps1 = 7 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2007–2008 | clubs2 = [[Floriana F.C.|Floriana]] | caps2 = 24 | goals2 = 4 | years3 = 2008–2011 | clubs3 = [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]] | caps3 = 51 | goals3 = 8 | years4 = 2008–2009 | clubs4 = → [[Rushden & Diamonds F.C.|Rushden & Diamonds]] (loan){{cite web|url=https://rdfc1992.com/2012/08/05/yannick-bolasie/|title=Yannick Bolasie at rdfc1992.com|accessdate=26 August 2016}} | caps4 = 7 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2009 | clubs5 = → [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]] (loan) | caps5 = 20 | goals5 = 3 | years6 = 2009–2010 | clubs6 = → [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]] (loan) | caps6 = 22 | goals6 = 2 | years7 = 2011–2012 | clubs7 = [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] | caps7 = 23 | goals7 = 1 | years8 = 2012–2016 | clubs8 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | caps8 = 133 | goals8 = 12 | years9 = 2016– | clubs9 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | caps9 = 29 | goals9 = 2 | years10 = 2018–2019 | clubs10 = → [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] (loan) | caps10 = 21 | goals10 = 2 | years11 = 2019– | clubs11 = → [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]] (loan) | caps11 = 3 | goals11 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2013– | nationalteam1 = [[DR Congo national football team|DR Congo]] | nationalcaps1 = 33 | nationalgoals1 = 9 | club-update = 19:32, 17 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 13:58, 16 June 2018 (UTC) }} '''Yannick Bolasie''' (born 24 May 1989) is a professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] for [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]] on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]. Born in [[Lyon]], he has played in [[the Football League]] for [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]], [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]], [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]], [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] and [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]]. Bolasie has been [[Cap (sport)|capped]] at international level by the [[DR Congo national football team|Democratic Republic of the Congo]]. ==Club career== ===Early career=== Bolasie began his career with [[Rushden & Diamonds F.C.|Rushden & Diamonds]] at age 16. He spent four months as a member of their youth team and then had a spell with [[Hillingdon Borough F.C.|Hillingdon Borough]] in the [[Southern Football League]] before moving across Europe to play for [[Floriana F.C.|Floriana]] in the [[Maltese Premier League]].{{cite news|title=Il-ħabib personali Malti tal-plejer ta' Everton Bolasie|url=http://www.one.com.mt/news/il-habib-personali-malti-tal-plejer-ta-everton-bolasie/|work=[[One (Maltese TV channel)|One News]]|date=22 August 2015|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304081138/http://www.one.com.mt/news/il-habib-personali-malti-tal-plejer-ta-everton-bolasie/|archivedate=4 March 2016 |language=mt}}[http://www.thediamondsfc.com/page/ProfilesDetail/0,,10784~43988,00.html "Yannick Bolasie"] Rushden & Diamonds; Retrieved 10 August 2010 {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201065643/http://www.thediamondsfc.com/page/ProfilesDetail/0,,10784~43988,00.html |date=1 December 2008 }} He returned to England in 2008 after being offered a trial with [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]] and impressed enough to be offered a two-year contract.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/p/plymouth_argyle/7512355.stm "Teenager Bolasie opts for Argyle"] BBC Sport, 17 July 2008; Retrieved 10 August 2010 He joined [[Dagenham & Redbridge F.C.|Dagenham & Redbridge]] on trial with a view to a loan move[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/p/plymouth_argyle/7644168.stm "Bolasie back from Daggers trial"] BBC Sport, 30 September 2008; Retrieved 10 August 2010 before returning to Rushden & Diamonds on loan near the end of the year.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/r/rushden_and_diamonds/7742855.stm "Rushden sign Plymouth midfielder"] BBC Sport, 21 November 2008; Retrieved 10 August 2010 He made his debut against [[Eastbourne Borough F.C.|Eastbourne Borough]] on 29 November,[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_conf/7727623.stm "Rushden 2–0 Eastbourne"] BBC Sport, 22 November 2008; Retrieved 10 August 2010 and made seven appearances in the [[2008–09 Football Conference|Conference]] before returning to Argyle in January 2009. Bolasie then joined [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]] on loan,[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/b/barnet/7845749.stm "Bolasie makes Barnet loan switch"] BBC Sport, 22 January 2009; Retrieved 10 August 2010 making his [[Football League]] debut against [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]] on 24 January 2009.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_3/7844305.stm "Accrington 1–1 Barnet"] BBC Sport, 23 January 2009; Retrieved 10 August 2010 He scored his first goal two weeks later, opening the scoring in a 3–3 draw against [[Grimsby Town F.C.|Grimsby Town]].[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_3/7869550.stm "Barnet 3–3 Grimsby"] BBC Sport, 10 February 2009; Retrieved 10 August 2010 Bolasie returned to Argyle at the end of the [[2008–09 Football League|2008–09 season]] having made 20 league appearances for Barnet, scoring three goals.[http://www.soccerbase.com/squad_season.sd?seasonid=138&teamid=344 "Barnet 2008/2009 player appearances"] Soccerbase; Retrieved 10 August 2010 The club's manager, [[Ian Hendon]], was keen to bring Bolasie back, but dismissed the chances of signing him permanently. Hendon said, "Yannick is still under contract at Plymouth, so it is likely that he will return there at the end of the season."[http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11705_5187907,00.html "Hendon keen to keep trio"] Sky Sports, 14 April 2009; Retrieved 10 August 2010 He rejoined the Barnet squad in July 2009 ahead of the new season on a six-month loan,[http://www.pafc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10364~1719360,00.html "Benefit time"] Plymouth Argyle; Retrieved 10 August 2010 {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090713022909/http://www.pafc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10364~1719360,00.html |date=13 July 2009 }} and hoped it would act as a springboard to winning a place in the Argyle [[first team]].[http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11688_5487285,00.html "Bolasie eyes Pilgrims future"] Sky Sports, 12 August 2009; Retrieved 10 August 2010 Bolasie scored against Grimsby again in October 2009, capping a fine display with a fierce shot from 30 yards[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_3/8273393.stm "Barnet 3–0 Grimsby"] BBC Sport, 3 October 2009; Retrieved 10 August 2010 Bolasie scored his second goal of the season three weeks later against [[Darlington F.C.|Darlington]],[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_3/8306899.stm "Barnet 3–0 Darlington"] BBC Sport, 24 October 2009; Retrieved 10 August 2010 as Hendon's side maintained a place in the top half of the [[2009–10 Football League Two|League Two]] table.[http://www.statto.com/football/teams/barnet/2009-2010 "2009–10 Barnet season"] Statto.com (Statto Organisation Limited) Retrieved 10 August 2010 ===Plymouth Argyle=== [[File:Yannick Bolasie.jpg|thumb|upright|Bolasie training with [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]] in 2010]] Bolasie returned to Plymouth Argyle in January 2010,[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/b/barnet/8448445.stm "Bees Bolasie returns to Plymouth"] BBC Sport, 8 January 2010; Retrieved 10 August 2010 having made a further 22 league appearances for Barnet, scoring twice.[http://www.soccerbase.com/teams/team.sd?team_id=344&teamTabs=stats "Barnet 2009/2010 player appearances"] Soccerbase; Retrieved 10 August 2010 He was given a chance to impress by [[Paul Mariner]], who had succeeded Sturrock a month earlier, and included him in the squad to take on [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] on 13 February 2010.[http://www.thisiscornwall.co.uk/BENCH-DUTY-BOLASIE/story-11479994-detail/story.html#axzz2PDNjjqbs Bench duty for Bolasie] This is Cornwall (Local World), 16 February 2010 He made his debut for the club in that game, coming off the substitute bench to provide the momentum to turn a one nil deficit into a 3–1 win for the visitors.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/8508484.stm "Barnsley 1–3 Plymouth"] BBC Sport, 13 February 2010; Retrieved 13 February 2010 He scored his first goal for the club two weeks later at [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]].[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/8534714.stm "Sheff Utd 4–3 Plymouth"] BBC Sport, 27 February 2010; Retrieved 27 February 2010 The pacy winger,[http://www.thisiscornwall.co.uk/Winger-Bolasie-Home-Park-hopes/story-11463509-detail/story.html#axzz2PDNjjqbs Winger Bolasie has Home Park hopes] This is Cornwall (Local World), 14 August 2009; Retrieved 1 April 2013 ended the season with 16 [[2009–10 Football League Championship|Championship]] appearances to his name,[http://www.soccerbase.com/teams/team.sd?team_id=2036&teamTabs=stats "Plymouth 2009/2010 player appearances"] Soccerbase; Retrieved 10 August 2010 but could not prevent the club from being relegated to [[Football League One|League One]]. Bolasie was offered a new contract by the club in April 2010,[http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11095_6118172,00.html "Bolasie keen on new deal"] Sky Sports; 26 April 2010; Retrieved 10 August 2010 and Bolasie signed it in July after the arrival of [[Peter Reid]] as the club's new manager.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/p/plymouth_argyle/8777368.stm "Bolasie signs new deal at Argyle"] BBC Sport, 30 June 2010; Retrieved 10 August 2010 ===Bristol City=== Bolasie was transferred to [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] on 6 June 2011 for an undisclosed fee and signed a two-year contract.{{cite news|title=Bristol City sign Plymouth Argyle's Yannick Bolasie|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/13595516.stm| publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=6 June 2011|date=6 June 2011}}{{cite news|title=Bristol City manager Keith Millen delighted as Yannick Bolasie set to sign|url=http://www.thisisbristol.co.uk/Bristol-City-manager-Keith-Millen-delighted/story-12717390-detail/story.html|accessdate=6 June 2011|work=This is Bristol|publisher=Local World|date=6 June 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110609205517/http://www.thisisbristol.co.uk/Bristol-City-manager-Keith-Millen-delighted/story-12717390-detail/story.html#|archive-date=9 June 2011|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} He scored his first goal for the club in a 3–1 win against [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on 9 April 2012.{{cite news|title=Bristol City 3–1 Coventry|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17581337|work=BBC Sport|accessdate=22 April 2012|date=9 April 2012}} Prior to the match against Barnsley later that month, Bolasie was named Young Player of the Year by the Supporters Club and Trust after a fans vote.{{cite web|title=Jon Lands Top Fans' Award|url=http://www.bcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10327~2743276,00.html|publisher=Bristol City F.C|accessdate=22 April 2012|date=21 April 2012}} He submitted a written transfer request in August 2012 because he wanted to move back to London.{{cite news|title=Bristol City's Yannick Bolasie submits transfer request|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19312112|work=BBC Sport|publisher=BBC|accessdate=27 January 2013|date=19 August 2012}}{{cite news|title=Yannick Bolasie asks to leave Bristol City as Crystal Palace wait to swoop|url=http://www.thisisbristol.co.uk/Yannick-Bolasie-asks-leave-Bristol-City-Crystal/story-16733203-detail/story.html|accessdate=27 January 2013|work=This is Bristol|publisher=Local World|date=19 August 2012}} ===Crystal Palace=== In August 2012, Bolasie signed a three-year contract with [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] for an undisclosed fee.{{cite web|title=Freedman Ties Up Bolasie Deal|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2012/august/freedman-ties-up-bolasie-deal/|publisher=Crystal Palace F.C|accessdate=24 August 2012|date=24 August 2012}}{{cite news|title=Crystal Palace sign Darcy Blake, Yannick Bolasie and Andre Mortiz|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19360842|work=BBC Sport|publisher=BBC|accessdate=27 January 2013|date=24 August 2012}}{{cite news|title=Crystal Palace sign Bristol City winger|url=http://www.ilfordrecorder.co.uk/sport/sport-football/crystal_palace_sign_bristol_city_winger_1_1494092|accessdate=27 January 2013|work=Ilford Recorder|publisher= Archant Community Media|date=24 August 2012}} He made his debut in a 2–1 defeat at [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]],{{cite news|last=Ritson|first=Mark|title=Darcy Blake, Yannick Bolasie and Andre Moritz impress Dougie Freedman|url=http://www.thisiscroydontoday.co.uk/Darcy-Blake-Yannick-Bolasie-Andre-Moritz-impress/story-16771217-detail/story.html|accessdate=27 January 2013|work=This is Croydon Today|publisher=Local World|date=27 August 2012}} and scored his first goal for Palace in a 5–0 home win against [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]]. He was an unused substitute for Palace in the [[2013 Football League Championship play-off Final]] as the ''Eagles'' defeated [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] 1–0 to gain promotion to the [[Premier League]] for the [[2013–14 Premier League|2013–14 season]].{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/may/27/crystal-palace-watford-live-championship-play-off-final|title=Crystal Palace v Watford – as it happened|date=28 May 2013|work=The Guardian}} Bolasie made his Premier League debut as a substitute against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] at [[Anfield]] on 5 October 2013.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/24350200|title=Liverpool 3–1 Crystal Palace|date=5 October 2013|work=BBC}} He was [[Ejection (sports)#Association football|sent-off]] in the 78th minute of a 1–0 win at [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] on 23 November 2013,{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/24968969|title=Hull 0–1 Crystal Palace|date=23 November 2013|work=BBC}} and scored his first Premier League goal in a 3–2 win over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] at [[Goodison Park]] on 21 September 2014.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29196080|title=Everton 2–3 Crystal Palace|date=21 September 2014|work=BBC}} On 11 April 2015, Bolasie scored an 11-minute [[List of Premier League hat-tricks|hat-trick]] against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] in a 4–1 win at the [[Stadium of Light]], becoming the first Crystal Palace player to score a hat-trick in the Premier League.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32180018 |title=Sunderland 0–4 Crystal Palace |date=11 April 2015 |accessdate=11 April 2015 |publisher=[[BBC Sport]]}}{{cite web | url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11706/9801543/palace-players-pay-tribute-to-bolasie-after-hat-trick | title=Crystal Palace players hail Yannick Bolasie after hat-trick | publisher=Sky Sports | accessdate=12 April 2015}} He signed a new three-and-a-half-year deal for Crystal Palace early in the 2015–16 season.{{cite web|title=Yannick Bolasie signs new Crystal Palace contract|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34371693|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=27 September 2015|date=26 September 2015}} ===Everton=== On 15 August 2016, Bolasie joined [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] for a reported £25 million transfer fee.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37083859|title=Yannick Bolasie: Everton sign midfielder from Crystal Palace for £25m|work=BBC Sport|date=15 August 2016|accessdate=15 August 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/aug/15/yannick-bolasie-signs-everton-crystal-palace|title=Yannick Bolasie signs for Everton from Crystal Palace for £25m|work=The Guardian|date=15 August 2016|accessdate=15 August 2016|author=Fifield, Dominic}} He made his debut as a substitute in a 2–1 win away against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] five days later,{{cite news|last1=Kirkbride|first1=Phil|title=West Brom 1–2 Everton full time report: Blues come from behind to give Ronald Koeman first win as boss|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/west-brom-1-2-everton-11777428|accessdate=24 August 2016|work=Liverpool Echo|date=20 August 2016}} and three days after that made his first start for Everton, in a 4–0 [[EFL Cup]] win at home to [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]].{{cite news|last1=Jolly|first1=Richard|title=Arouna Koné scores two late goals as Everton cruise past Yeovil|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/aug/23/everton-yeovil-efl-cup-match-report|accessdate=24 August 2016|work=The Guardian|date=23 August 2014}} Bolasie sustained an injury to his right [[anterior cruciate ligament]] in a 1–1 draw with [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] on 4 December 2016,{{cite news|last1=Times|first1=The|title=Bolasie out for the season|url=http://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/bolasie-out-for-the-season-zt6czf5rk|accessdate=31 December 2016|work=The Times|date=6 December 2016}} and was out injured until 26 December 2017.{{cite web | last=James | first=Stuart | url = https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/dec/26/west-bromwich-albion-everton-premier-league-match-report | title=West Brom's Craig Dawson tops list of missed chances against Everton | work=The Guardian | date=26 December 2017 | accessdate=30 December 2017}} === Aston Villa === On 25 August 2018, Bolasie signed for [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on a season-long loan from Everton.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45281262|title=Yannick Bolasie: Aston Villa sign Everton winger on season-long loan|last=|first=|date=25 August 2018|work=[[BBC Sport]]|access-date=25 August 2018}} He returned to Everton from his loan early on 21 January 2019.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2019/jan/21/evertons-yannick-bolasie-set-to-cut-short-aston-villa-loan-spell|title=Everton’s Yannick Bolasie cuts short Aston Villa loan spell|last=James|first=Stuart|date=21 January 2019|work=The Guardian|access-date=21 January 2019}} ===Anderlecht=== Bolasie signed for Belgian side [[R.S.C. Anderlecht|Anderlecht]] on loan for the remainder of the 2018–19 season.{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47073854 |title=Idrissa Gueye: Everton reject Paris St-Germain bid as Yannick Bolasie is loaned out |publisher=BBC Sport |last=McNulty |first=Phil |date=31 January 2019 |accessdate=1 February 2019}} ==International career== Bolasie was eligible to represent France, England and DR Congo internationally through birth, upbringing and heritage respectively. In January 2013 while playing in the Championship for Crystal Palace, Bolasie rejected the chance to represent the DR Congo in the [[2013 Africa Cup of Nations]] claiming that he did not want to disrupt making progress in his club career.{{cite news|last=Aarons|first=Ed|title=Africa Cup of Nations 2013: Bolasie rejects DR Congo call-up |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20831198|work=BBC Sport|publisher=BBC|accessdate=27 January 2013|date=23 December 2012}} In March 2013, Bolasie was again called up to the [[DR Congo national football team|Democratic Republic of Congo squad]],{{cite news|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11706/8578947/Yannick-Bolasie-delighted-to-be-playing-for-DR-Congo|title=Yannick Bolasie delighted to be playing for DR Congo|author=Graeme Bailey|work=Sky Sports|publisher=BSkyB|date=27 March 2013|accessdate=1 April 2013}} and made his international debut{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/statisticsandrecords/players/player=367629/index.html|title=Bolasie Yannick YALA|publisher=FIFA|work=FIFA.com|accessdate=1 April 2013}} in a [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (CAF)|2014 World Cup qualification]] 0–0 draw with [[Libya national football team|Libya]].{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/preliminaries/africa/matches/round=258334/match=300181940/index.html|title=Congo DR 0–0 Libya|publisher=FIFA|work=FIFA.com|date=24 March 2013|accessdate=1 April 2013}} Bolasie was selected in the Congolese squad for the [[2015 Africa Cup of Nations]] in [[Equatorial Guinea]]. He scored the equaliser in their first group game, a 1–1 draw against Zambia at the [[Nuevo Estadio de Ebebiyín]] on 18 January.{{cite news|last1=Hughes|first1=Ian|title=Zambia 1–1 DR Congo|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30766342|accessdate=18 January 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=18 January 2015}} The team finished in third place. ==Personal life== His parents were born in [[Zaire]], now the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Bolasie was born in the French city of [[Lyon]],{{cite news|title=Reid: Yannick Bolasie has a lot to learn but could be a success|url=http://www.thisisplymouth.co.uk/Reid-Yannick-Bolasie-lot-learn-success/story-12722660-detail/story.html|accessdate=27 January 2013|work=This is Plymouth|publisher=Local World|date=7 June 2011}}{{cite news|last=Prentki|first=Tom|title=Crystal Palace striker Glenn Murray returns to haunt Brighton manager Gus Poyet with double strike |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/championship/9717713/Crystal-Palace-striker-Glenn-Murray-returns-to-haunt-Brighton-manager-Gus-Poyet-with-double-strike.html|accessdate=27 January 2013|work=The Telegraph|publisher=Telegraph Media Group|date=2 December 2012}}{{cite news|last=Gentry|first=Nick|title=Eagles winger just happy to be playing again after Bristol City nightmare| url=http://www.newsshopper.co.uk/sport/football/palace/10084856.Eagles_winger_just_happy_to_be_playing_again_after_Bristol_City_nightmare/|work=News Shopper|publisher=Newsquest|accessdate=27 January 2013|date=3 December 2012}} but moved to England when he was seven months old and grew up in the London borough of [[London Borough of Brent|Brent]].{{cite web|last=Bailey|first=Graeme|title=Buzzing Bolasie|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11706/8495165/Buzzing-Bolasie|work=Sky Sports|publisher=BSkyB|accessdate=12 February 2013|date=12 February 2013}}{{cite news|last=Cawley|first=Richard|title=Palace wing star Bolasie to keep Congo waiting|url=http://www.southlondon-today.co.uk/sport.cfm?id=42814&headline=Palace%20wing%20star%20Bolasie%20to%20keep%20Congo%20waiting |accessdate=27 January 2013|work=South London Press|publisher=Tindle Newspapers|date=10 December 2012}} [[Lomana LuaLua]], [[Kazenga LuaLua]] and [[Trésor Kandol]] are his cousins.{{cite news|last=Bailey|first=Graeme|title=Yannick Bolasie set to stay with Crystal Palace rather than play in Africa Cup of Nations| url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11706/8265285/Yannick-Bolasie-set-to-stay-with-Crystal-Palace-rather-than-play-in-Africa-Cup-of-Nations|work=Sky Sports|publisher=BSkyB|accessdate=27 January 2013|date=21 November 2012}}{{cite news|last=Happe|first=Liam| title=Kandol glad to be back in the thick of it |url=http://www.newsshopper.co.uk/sport/4186369.Kandol_glad_to_be_back_in_the_thick_of_it/ |work=News Shopper|publisher=Newsquest|accessdate=27 January 2013|date=9 March 2009}} His younger brother Ruddock Yala is a footballer, who played for Harrow Borough F.C., Grays Athletic F.C., [[Borehamwood F.C.]] and [[Maldon & Tiptree F.C.]].{{cite news |last=Callender Edwards |first=Tyrone |title=OTPN Interview | Ruddock Yala – Grays Athletic (Bolasie's youngest brother) |url=http://www.offthepostnews.co.uk/?p=7387 |work=Off the Post News |publisher= |accessdate=27 January 2013 |date=9 March 2009}} Bolasie holds an active interest in [[Grime (music)|grime music]]. In 2014, he filmed a [[rap battle]] with fellow professional footballer [[Bradley Wright-Phillips]] for the long running grime DVD series Lord of the Mics.{{cite web|url=http://thisisthecut.com/the-return-of-lord-of-the-mics/|title=The Return of Lord of the Mics|last=|first=|date=2014-03-19|website=The Cut|publisher=|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160401070340/http://thisisthecut.com/the-return-of-lord-of-the-mics/|archive-date=2016-04-01|dead-url=yes|access-date=2017-12-30}}{{cite web|url=https://in.news.yahoo.com/footballers-engage-epic-rap-battle-highly-anticipated-lord-090147741.html|title=Footballers to engage in epic rap battle in highly anticipated 'Lord of the Mics'
